column4: hello?  how can I repair the essential files (like apt-get...) to my ubuntu install?
I removed most of /usr by accident
yes, it's a big mistake.  "tar" still seems to work, maybe I can download an archive to install?
is your /home on a seperate partition?

sorry, I didn't notice that message from you (I should get a better irc client).  my /home is not on a separate partition, and there is an additional complication.  I don't have a working cd drive, so it would be a pain to just rebuild from scratch.
reinstalling is your only actual option, tbh.
is there any way to get the basic things back, like chroot?
not really; things are a sure mess.
if you want chroot though just use a live cd
ack. Other options in /msg ubotu install
come again?  you want me too message someone?
the bot; it returns a factoid.
ok, I think I can get my data from /home off the partition.
no... mount is working but I don't have root access because sudo is gone. fuck!
